title: Looking For A Job? New Zealand-Based Cannabis Company Is Looking For Experienced 'Weed Growers'

Looking For A Job? New Zealand-Based Cannabis Company Is Looking For Experienced 'Weed Growers'

Looking For A Job? New Zealand-Based Cannabis Company Is Looking For Experienced 'Weed Growers'

If you have any experience with cultivating weed on large scale, there's a job up for grabs.

A New Zealand-based company is currently offering a position for cultivation - project manager, preferably with cannabis experience.

According to the job advertisement of the company named Rua Bioscience, the cultivation project manager 'will play a key role in setting up and managing stage two of [the company's] cultivation and growing activities'.

Rua Bioscience is New Zealand’s first company to receive a licence to cultivate medicinal cannabis, states their website.

Reuters

Aspirants will need to have the 'knowledge of growing methods including micronutrients, beneficial bacteria, and nutrient implementation'.

'Knowledge of plant diseases, insects, and fungi, as well as biological treatment options'.

The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree in horticulture or agronomy, and at least three years of experience - both in management and large-scale commercial cultivation of cannabis, states the website.

Reuters

Apart from this, the company also stresses on a healthy work-life balance.

'We work hard, so we think it's important to make time to celebrate our successes too', reads the website description.

According to website, the company named Rua has played a key role in the development of world-leading Medicinal Cannabis legislation and regulations. The job offer, however, is only open for people who reside in New Zealand.

But, if you do plan on moving there for good and have any experience with 'Weed farming', there's a job right there.
description: According to the job advert posted to Seek on Tuesday, the cultivation project manager will play a key role in setting up and managing stage two of our cultivation and growing activities.Job responsibilities will include hands-on support for all cultivation activities, reporting on grow status metrics and overseeing budgets for the cultivation operation.
